name: Telegram Chatbot with Voice Recognition and Message Batching using OpenAI
description:
This Telegram workflow batches rapid-fire messages from the same user into one prompt (20–30s debounce), then sends a single AI reply.

It uses **two Google Sheets**:
- **Message Retention** (`date | user_id | message`) — queues incoming messages.
- **Message  Checkup** (`user_id | is_waiting | last_updated`) — debounces per user.

Flow per message:
1. Log to **Message Retention**.
2. Read **Message  Checkup** for that `user_id`. If empty, synthesize `{ is_waiting:false }`.
3. IF (**OR**):
   - `last_updated` is **older than 30s**, **or**
   - `is_waiting` is **false**  
   → Start wait window: set `is_waiting=true`, update `last_updated`, **Wait** (e.g., 30s).
4. After Wait: fetch all queued messages for the user, merge them, delete those rows, send one AI answer to Telegram, then clear the Waiting row.
5. If a new message arrives while waiting, we only refresh `last_updated` (extend the window) — we do **not** start another wait.

Copy/paste:
- Older-than-30s: `{{ new Date(Date.now() - 30000).toISOString() }}`
- “No Rows” normalizer (Code node) ensures the IF always has data to check.

Supports text and voice (voice via Whisper). Works reliably on Telegram once the webhook is registered and Sheets are shared with the service account.

nodes.name: Delete rows or columns from sheet1

parameters.content:
# Message Batching

## You will need two Google Sheets to make it work:

### 1. Message retention: 

Incoming messages will be kept and then deleted to keep things clean. 
Create three columns: 

date | user_id | message

### 2. Message Checkup

Will add TRUE boolean to the is_waiting column as we wait for the next message (30 seconds)	
Create three columns: 																						

user_id	| is_waiting | last_updated

# Transcription Pipeline

## Add your Open AI API key to transcribe audio messages using Whisper



































### Voice messages → downloaded with Telegram, transcribed via Whisper, saved as processedMessage.

### Text messages → passed straight through as processedMessage.

### Files/media (documents, images, videos, etc.) → politely refused with a short reply to the user.

### All outputs (voice → text, plain text, or refusal) are normalized so the rest of the workflow always sees a single field processedMessage with the user’s content or an error message.

### This way, the workflow can differentiate voice, text, and files, and always behave consistently.

parameters.toolDescription: Use this node to access your Knowledge Base

parameters.content:
# How to run this on Telegram

**1) Create a bot + add creds**
- @BotFather → `/newbot` → copy Bot Token.
- In n8n: **Credentials → Telegram API** → paste token.
- Add **Telegram Trigger** → select credential → **Execute Node** once to register webhook.

**2) Enable updates**
- In **Telegram Trigger**, enable **`message`** (add photo/document if needed).

**3) Voice messages (optional)**
- Pipeline: **Telegram Trigger → Telegram (Get File by `file_id`) → OpenAI Whisper (Transcribe) → Set**.

**4) Google Sheets (two sheets)**
- Share both sheets with the **service account email** from your n8n Google Sheets credential (Editor).
- **Msg Retention** columns: `date | user_id | message`
- **Message Checkup** columns: `user_id | is_waiting | last_updated`

**5) Debounce / batching**
- After **Append row in Msg Retention**:
  - **Get row(s) in Msg Waiting** by `user_id` → **No Rows** code normalizes empty to `{ user_id, is_waiting:false, last_updated:null }`.
  - **IF (OR)**:
    - `last_updated` **before** `{{ new Date(Date.now() - 20000).toISOString() }}`
    - `is_waiting` is **false**
  - **TRUE** → **Update Message Checkup** (`is_waiting=true`, `last_updated=$now`) → **Wait (e.g., 30s)** → **Get rows from Msg Retention** → **Batch Messages** (merge) → **Delete those rows** → **AI Agent** → **Send to TG** → **Delete row in Message Checkup**.
  - **FALSE** → only **Update Message Checkup** (`is_waiting=true`, fresh `last_updated`) — **no extra Wait**.

**6) Copy-paste expressions**
- “Older than 20s” right side (IF → date before):
  `{{ new Date(Date.now() - 20000).toISOString() }}`
- Keep IF → **Type Validation = loose** for `is_waiting` so `"true"`/`true` both work.

**7) “No Rows” safety (Code node)**

# Common pitfalls (TG + Sheets)

- **Webhook not set**: Open the **Telegram Trigger** and **Execute** once to register. Ensure your n8n URL is public + HTTPS.
- **Sheets permissions**: Share the sheets with the **service account email** from the Google Sheets credential (Editor). Otherwise appends/reads silently fail.
- **Date comparisons**: Use ISO (`{{ $now }}`) so “before” comparisons work across rows.
- **Duplicate waits (race)**: Only the **TRUE** branch starts a Wait. The **FALSE** branch must *only* refresh `last_updated`. This prevents parallel timers for the same user.
- **Cleanup order**:
  1) Batch & **delete Msg Retention rows** after merging.
  2) Send reply to TG.
  3) **Delete Msg Waiting row** (or set `is_waiting=false`) last.
- **Type mismatches**: If `is_waiting` is stored as text `"true"/"false"`, use IF’s **loose** validation or cast to boolean in a Code node.
- **Voice transcripts**: Make sure your Link/IF lets either text **or** voice path feed into the merge.

# AI Agent node (plug-and-play)

**Goal:** take the batched user text and produce one reply. You can keep it simple, or attach memory + a vector database.

## Minimal setup
- **Agent node:** `AI Agent`
- **System prompt:** *Add Yours*
- **User text:** `{{ $('Batch Messages').item.json.message }}`

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
